My gosh... that's all i have to say after playing this game. The puzzles are hard but not so hard that you want to give up and there is an actual ending to the game that isn't that hard to achieve. I love the characters even the most non-important ones like Jerry i enjoyed that him and Wheatly got into an argument. I think the voice actors did an awesome job! I loved the Wheatly character the most even though he was evil! He still made me laugh.

A really great sequal to A really great Puzzler:
9.2/10 Would indeed recomemnd to anyone who likes puzzle games.

Right off the bat I'm going to say this- I did not enjoy this game, but I can see why some people might, My reasons will come later.

In short, Portal as a whole is a fun physics puzzle game that will never have anther sequel so long as Valve owns the IP because Valve doesn't believe in the existence of 3, but for what it's worth, it's a nice installment.

In Portal 2; Wheatly, a new robot, tries to get you out of aperture labs as everythings gone to shit since Chell (you) was (were) in stasis. This accidently revives GLaDOS from the last game and you then are forced to do tests and what not same as the first. Nothing wrong with these tests, my major gripe comes from when wheatly takes over GLaDOS' body and sends you deep underground to the old aperture labs. One can quickly notice a distinct lack of portalable surfaces, which only become more and more scarce. It quickly becomes ridiculously difficult to find the one portal-able surface in an otherwise empty room in order to progress. This not only killed all game flow but made the game tedious. 

I'd normally have more to say, but I quit this game very early on because it was so boring that not even the briliant writing could salvage the game.

But- the actual tests are fun, introducing the new goo element to the gameplay, which give you abilities such as running faster or bouncing up in the air. This opens up an entire world of possibilities that I unfortunately can't be bothered to explore further. There is also co-op which cuts out the parts I disliked in the story and instead connects lab tests in a hub-world. These tests are fun and challenging because they utilize the 4-porta mechnic introduced with the addition of your co-op portal gun which can shoot purple and red (IIRC) portals.

Disliked the story, loved the co-op puzzles, although they also suffered a bit from "Where the hell is the one surface I can put a portal on" -itis at times, nowhere near t the extend of the single player and it never really made the expirience unenjoyable.

Play for the co-op, not the story.
7 /10

Mind Fucked, We're Done Here.

The single-player part of Portal 2 introduces a cast of new characters, new puzzle elements, and a much more confusing test chambers.  Portal 2 will leave players to explore never-before-seen areas of the Aperture Science Labs and be reunited with GLaDOS, the occasionally murderous computer companion who guided them through the original game. (Portal 1)

The game‚Äôs two-player cooperative mode features its own entirely campaign with a unique story, test chambers, and two new player characters. This new mode forces players to reconsider everything they thought they knew about portals. Success will require them to not just act cooperatively, but to think cooperatively. 

Portal 2 is a must buy game!
Es el mejor juego. Despues del final llore porque era super injusto que le hicieran eso; este juego tiene emocion, dificultad, verdades y dolor (segun mi experiencia).

I still enjoy playing this game years after it came out, due to the incredibly engaging and mind-bending puzzles and narrative. Portal 2 is still my favorite game, not to mention that the included co-op series essentially makes it two games in one. A must-have for everyone who has ever touched a keyboard or console controller in their lifetime.

Maybe my favorite game of all time. 

I just wish i could forget the solutions to all the tests and play it all over again.

Mind bending gameplay mixed with some of the most innovative mechanics of the past decade deliver a truly unique experience. puzzles that are just challenging enough to provoque you but not make you loose your mind. And the coop campaign is just the icing on the cake (heh).

Visually good looking, not the best in the world, but the world is detailed enough to innmerse you right in. The sound design should really be noted for its amazing quality as it is the thing that really sucks you in to the crazy world of aperture science.

5/5

This game is awesome! With the challenging puzzles and (at times) made me want to throw my computer out the window when i found the solution this game is now my 3rd favorite. I love some of the ideas the developers had like to go into the parts of the original apeture laboratories. One of my favorite things is that my a person i know said that the portal universe is not the same as the half life universe but then when i showed him screenshots of the (easter egg spoiler) buoys that said "borealis" i got the best reaction. I have only two problems with this awesome game and they are #1: I kind of wish that maybe glados would tell you things about the original apeture laboratorey's (Basically more to fill in the story gaps) and #2: is i don't like the turret block mixes because there well.... awkward because they first get that vibe from glados when she is in the potato but when you see the blocks it gives you an even bigger awkward feeling and it makes glados seem normal. My only wish was if i could see cave Jonson in game or even in a cut scene....He was hilarious!
Why are you even reading this?! JUST BUY THE FUCKING GAME!

What's great about this game, aside from the wonderful new repulsion and propulsion gel mechanics, is the fact that playing the first Portal isn't completely necessary. You learn enough to play the game without confusion. What is even better is how the story unfolds as Chell tests her way through the forgotten chambers of Aperture's early days. Honestly, I would love to see a Portal 3.
From cubes to deadly laser beams that can cut off a human's head, this game is a good time waster and has a great story line. 10/10

bem vamos a an√°lise de portal 2,estou muito orgulhoso de fazer um review desse jogo.

ap√≥s alguns acontecimentos em portal 1,que se criou uma ponte no final para uma sequencia,a valve volta em 2011,lan√ßando o mesmo jogo com altera√ßoes em sua jogabilidade graficos e complexidade,esse √© portal 2.

o jogo esta muito mais d√≠namico que o primeiro,com mais possibilidades,e puzzles que voc√™ mais usar√° a cabe√ßa construindo assim seu tempo de jogatina.
